qas.question: Highways built in the Amazon rainforest were built primarily for what kind of farmers?
What did creating highways in the Amazon rainforest lead to?

How much higher was the rate of deforestation in 2000, to 2005 compared to 1995 to 2000?
What happened to the rate of deforestation in the Amazon region of Brazil between 2004 and 2014?
What type of farmers have opposed many of the transportation projects in the Amazon?
What was unsuccessful in opening the rain forced Emily to decrease settlement?
The deforestation decreased by 18% during what years?
deforestation increased in Brazil during what years?
What type of projects are widely supported?

context: The needs of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>soy<a0_2/><a0_1/> farmers<b5_0/><a0_0/> have been used to justify many of the controversial <b9_0>transportation projects<b9_0/> that are currently developing in the Amazon. <b6_0>The first two highways<b6_0/> successfully opened up the rainforest and led to <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>increased settlement and deforestation<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. The mean annual deforestation rate from <b7_0>2000 to 2005<b7_0/> (<a2_1>22,392 km2 or <a2_0><a2_2>8,646<a2_2/> sq mi<a2_1/><a2_0/> per year) was <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>18%<a3_2/><a3_1/> higher<a3_0/> than in the previous five years (19,018 km2 or 7,343 sq mi per year). Although <a4_0>deforestation has <a4_1><a4_2>declined<a4_0/> significantly<a4_2/><a4_1/> in the Brazilian Amazon between <b8_0>2004 and 2014<b8_0/>, there has been an increase to the present day.
